title: Synthetic Recap
body:
DALLAS – On a night where offense was a premium and every possession was a grind, one man transcended the struggle. Alonzo Mourning didn’t just lead the Miami Heat to a 91-84 victory over the Dallas Mavericks; he authored a performance of such raw, dominant force that it carved its place in the annals of the franchise.

From the opening tip, this was a defensive war. The scoreboard reflected the grit, but Mourning’s stat line screamed of an unstoppable force. The Heat center was a titan in the paint, pouring in a career-high and franchise-record 42 points on a ruthlessly efficient 15-of-23 shooting from the field. He was immovable on defense and inevitable on offense, a combination that left the Mavericks scrambling for answers that simply did not exist.

While Mourning’s offensive explosion was historic, his presence was felt just as powerfully on the glass. He corralled 15 rebounds, completing a Herculean double-double that underscored his complete command of the game. The Mavericks, led by a valiant 27-point effort from Jim Jackson, simply had no counter for the hurricane in the middle. Every double-team was met with power, every single-coverage was a mismatch.

In a game where no other player on either side cracked 20 points, Mourning’s 42 were not just points; they were a statement. He dragged the Heat across the finish line, ensuring they escaped Dallas with a hard-fought road win. This was more than a victory; it was the night Alonzo Mourning etched his name into the Miami Heat record books with a performance of sheer, unadulterated will.
